forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 5pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 59. South wind 18 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South southwest wind 10 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 44 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The scenes before you reveal San Francisco wrapped in a thick gray embrace, a city cloaked in a blanket of clouds that stretches toward the Golden Gate, hinting at the hint of rain that looms just a few hours away. The day is caught in a cycle of cool dampness and the restless breath of the south wind, stirring the streets and rustling through the trees. Visibility is diminished, as the fog hangs low, weaving in and around the buildings, whispering secrets only familiar to the seasoned San Franciscan. 

As the clock slides towards evening, the promise of rain beckons—an invitation to cozy up indoors, perhaps with a good book and a cup of rich coffee. If you must venture out, it’s wise to don layers; a warm jacket draped over a light sweater should serve you well against the brisk currents racing through the city. A stroll along the Embarcadero could unveil a captivating atmospheric dance of light as the clouds gather, but carry an umbrella, for the showers are expected to begin soon, unfurling throughout the night. Whether you seek the solace of a warm café or the gentle rhythm of the rain against your window, tonight in San Francisco, the weather sings a lullaby of comfort from the gray skies above.
